section.title: Detaching Virtual Machines from a Virtual Machine Pool
section.para: You can detach virtual machines from a virtual machine pool. Detaching a virtual machine removes it from the pool to become an independent virtual machine.

procedure.title: Detaching Virtual Machines from a Virtual Machine Pool

step.para: Use the Pools resource tab, tree mode, or the search function to find and select the virtual machine pool in the results list.
Ensure the virtual machine has a status of Down because you cannot detach a running virtual machine.
Click the Virtual Machines tab in the details pane to list the virtual machines in the pool.
Select one or more virtual machines and click Detach to open the Detach Virtual Machine(s) confirmation window.
Click OK to detach the virtual machine from the pool.

note.para: The virtual machine still exists in the environment and can be viewed and accessed from the Virtual Machines resource tab. Note that the icon changes to denote that the detached virtual machine is an independent virtual machine.

section.para: You have detached a virtual machine from the virtual machine pool.
